alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 8:19PM EST until December 31 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Essex, Morris and Passaic Counties. Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Essex, Morris and Passaic Counties. For the Passaic River...including Pine Brook, Singac...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Passaic River above Singac. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Sunday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EST Sunday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 6.6 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.3 feet on 01/26/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 8.6 Sun 7 pm 7.8 7.1 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
